title: Storage in Web Developer Tools won't refresh
content:
I've been using Firefox for my web development for quite a while, but lately I've noticed that the tab "Storage" in the Web Developer Tools won't refresh right away. I need to close Web Developer Tools and then reopen for it to refresh, which it quite annoying. I tried other browsers like Brave, and everything works fine there. I also tried uninstalling Firefox and removing all settings and extensions, but the problem persists.

Glad if anyone can help.
creator: ovinibortoletto

title: Connection to firefox account after password changing
content:
Hello,

I changed my firefox account password with https://accounts.firefox.com/settings/change_password?... on one of my devices (macmini). But since that, I can't connect to my account on my smartphone and my PC. This new password is updated and visible in Firefox Lockwise on all my devices I try to connect with my new password (it automatically appears in the field due to Lockwise). Firefox ask me an authorization code sent by mail. I put this code like 33ETDD3T. Then, Firefox answers me the password is bad ... I rebooted all my devices. I can see all my website logins and passwords in Lockwise on all my devices. I still access to https://accounts.firefox.com/settings on the macmini (but not on the smartphone and the PC). But I can't generate the recover key because Firefox asks the account password, which is refused. When I use my old password, it also fails. I have 84.0.1 Firefox on macmini and PC. I have 84.1.2 Firefox on my android smartphone.

I could do an account password reset. I exported logins and password contained in Lockwise, and my bookmarks. But is it the only solution I have ?

Thanks
creator: mimite06

title: firefox lockwise generate password
content:
Google reports these Mozilla instructions: "To generate a new password 

   Click on the password field.    Right-clickHold down the control key while you click on the password field to open the Context Menu.    Select Use Generated Password…    Firefox will generate a password. ...    Firefox will save the password for this website in Lockwise."

They do NOT work. Both Right-click+Control key while you click on the password field, and Right-click on Password field, to open the Context Menu, does NOT give an option called "Use Generated Password". See attached, duplicate screen shots. Thanks. Mr. Auto-Password.

title: Sustainability-project at the University of Applied Sciences Salzburg
content:
Dear Mozilla Firefox support team,

we are Marius Oeller and Chris Trausnitz and are students at the University of Applied Sciences Salzburg in Austria. We would need your help for a project we want to do in the context of sustainability at our university.

We want to install the search engine "Ecosia" as the standard search engine on our university server system.

Ecosia drives and supports the planting of forests by means of the search queries. By using Ecosia at an entire university, the number of search queries would of course increase further and thus strongly support the sustainable project of Ecosia.

To implement our idea, we contacted the IT department of our university, but they told us that they would have to change the default settings of Mozilla Firefox or change them manually with every browser update.

However, we didn't want to give in that easily and so we are now contacting you directly to ask if our project could be realized somehow.

We would be glad to hear from you and wish you a good start into the year 2021!!!

With kind regards,

Marius Oeller and Chris Trausnitz
creator: o.marius97

title: Youtube in 4K 30 FPS stuttering on Firefox. No stuttering on 4K 60 FPS.
content:
Win10 Bootcamp on new MacBook Pro with Radeon Pro 5600M. Device is powerful enough to run latest AAA games in high quality on 4K at 60 FPS.

New Edge plays videos like this in 4K at 30 FPS really well, but Firefox has very minor stuttering that is extremely annoying, as if it drops 1 frame out of 10, but "stats for nerds" don't show it. The videos just aren't as *smooth* as in Edge. It also has a big 1-2 second lag immediately after I change quality to 4K or unpause after switching tabs back, this doesn't exist on Edge.

Curiously, it plays 4K 60 FPS like this with much *less* lagging. I still notice a very minor stuttering compared to Edge, but not bad enough to be annoying, because it goes from 60 FPS to ~30 FPS at those times apparently.

Codec is VP9 in Edge and FF.

Tried: 

- safe mode - same issue - clean portable 86.0 Alpha 1 - same issue - about:support is here, I don't see anything criminal - performance profile using graphics preset is here: https://share.firefox.dev/3nMpss

I'm not sure where to dig here, since it's happening consistently even on latest nightly build and the symptoms are this weird.
creator: atata

title: Unable to save .mkv downloads without being asked, with 'open' as default, no checkbox
content:
On multiple machines (Windows 7-10), if I click on an MP4 or other media file, I have the option of checking the box to save the file without asking in the future. With .mkv files, the checkbox isn't there, so every time I have to go through the process of changing the default (play) action to save the file. I've checked preferences and there's no way to add mkv files to the default actions. I deleted the handlers... file to reset and start over, but same behavior...it wants to play the file, with no option to quit asking and just save it.

On these same machines, I can do the same download process with any other browser such as Opera, and it just saves the file as I've instructed it to do in preferences. So why the different (and long-term consistent) and annoying behavior with firefox? MP4, AVI, fine, but MKV?? No option, and it's not as if it's a new file type or new behavior.

I suppose one could say "what's the big deal, just change it when it asks?", but it seems like nonsensical and pointless behavior, which has continued for a long time, with other browsers able to deal with it properly. At the very least, how about a way to add file extensions manually to the list of actions in the options?

Please don't blame the web server for "not sending the proper information", as I've seen in some non-solution posts; the .mkv extension should tell enough, and it's over many servers. I looked in the registry to see if perchance I could patch it in there, but couldn't find entries, so I assume it's all in the handlers file.
creator: roberthaus

title: How to disable that mouse thumb buttons trigger "previous page" and "next page" in Firefox?
content:
I really want to disable that Firefox uses the mouse thumb buttons 4 and 5 as "previous page" and "next page" commands.

Example: Sometimes I study/play for hours a chess problem on https://tactics.chessbase.com/de/Solve but as soon the page gets reloaded it will be a new chess problem - no way to go back!

Somebody wrote a solution to disable the backspace key (on keyboard) triggering the "previous page" command, assuming the mouse thumb button 4 would be used by Firefox as backspace key. Unfortunately this assumption proofed to be wrong. The solution only disabled the backspace key to trigger the "previous page" command, but the mouse thumb buttons STILL DO TRIGGER the "previous page" and "next page" commands.

Where can I disable the mouse thumb buttons in Firefox - without disable the thumb buttons entirely in the Logitec software?
